result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel Rivera-Meza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The bond of $500.00 has been applied towards defendant's costs.

Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to G.R. due within 30 days and preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall obtain/maintain full time employment at discretion of probation.  Defendant shall obtain his GED/HSED or diploma through the adult diploma program at agent's discretion.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections.  If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.  The jail sentence is to begin immediately.  

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
The costs were previously paid from defendant's bond.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: for Plea & Sentencing held on September 25, 2015 - Lisa M. Weber, RMR, CRR

Defendant Samuel Rivera-Meza in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights complied with.  Attorney Tlusty moves to amend the charge to DC - 947.01.  Plea of no contest to the amended charge.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty and orders withheld sentence probation for one year with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; letter of apology to G.R. due within 30 days and preapproved by probation, counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; obtain/maintain full time employment at discretion of probation; obtain GED/HSED or adult  diploma program at agent's discretion.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Samuel Rivera-Meza in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  Court orders bond of $500.00 cash bond; booking  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm. - rt
*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.
